important_phrase: By mid-June, rains had significantly improved drought conditions in much of the District
Manufacturing activity grew, albeit at a slower pace than the previous report

Contacts report that wage pressures remained mostly stable, however there were also continued reports of rising starting salaries for lower-skill entry-level positions and ongoing upward wage pressure for some high-skill, low-supply positions
Overall loan growth varied--some institutions reported flat to slow growth while others indicated strong growth
New orders and production levels continued to rise, but at a slower pace than the previous reporting period
Reports on activity in May from District residential real estate contacts continued to signal modest but steady growth
Retailers noted that overall sales activity during Memorial Day weekend was at or slightly below expectations and sales levels from international shoppers weakened since the last report
Business activity in the First District expanded at a modest pace on average, but reports were mixed across firms and industries
Hiring plans among First District contacts ranged from flat to robust, and planned wage increases were stable at a slow-to-moderate pace
The outlook among contacts remains positive but cautious
Most contacts seemed optimistic about market activity and continued strong buyer demand, despite the low inventories
At the same time, contacts perceive that, between mid-May and late June, Boston experienced strong tourism activity
Milk prices were lower, which contributed to mounting losses for many dairy operations
Prices rose modestly
Overall, prices again rose modestly in late May and June
Home loan quality remained strong
Demand for electricity was little changed and shipping volumes increased slightly
Home sales increased a bit and house prices increased modestly on balance
Consumer spending increased modestly over the reporting period
Production increased at manufacturing plants, although at a slower pace than in the previous reporting period
District payrolls continued to expand, although at a slightly slower pace than in the previous reporting period
Wile most lending categories are slowing, CRE loans and residential purchase mortgages are performing relatively well
Manufacturing output grew at a slight pace during the reporting period, somewhat slower than earlier
Nonresidential real estate activity remains strong at elevated levels
Retail inventories were generally in good shape
Outlooks remained positive, although contacts were less optimistic compared with the previous report
Housing demand grew, lending activity increased, and the energy sector saw continued improvement
Selling prices increased at a slightly slower pace than in the prior report
Loan demand increased over the past six weeks, although at a slightly slower pace than in the previous reporting period
Demand for nonfinancial services expanded moderately over the past six weeks
Apartment demand improved and occupancy edged higher in the second quarter, following a generally slow first quarter
Auto lenders have tightened credit amid rising delinquencies
Livestock operators were slightly more optimistic than earlier, as cattle prices increased modestly from a year ago
Manufacturing activity picked up moderately, and professional, high-tech, and transportation contacts reported strong increases in sales
Prices in the construction sector rose modestly, with slight increases anticipated in the coming months
Demand for agricultural loans was mostly mixed in June
Shipments and new orders expanded modestly, and activity was considerably higher than a year ago
Residential home inventories moved modestly lower from year-ago levels
Consumer spending increased moderately, and additional moderate gains were expected in the months ahead
Activity in the energy and mining sectors increased slightly since the last report
Wges grew moderately to strongly, while price pressures remained modest
Wges grew moderately to strongly overall since the last report
District manufacturing activity increased moderately since the last report
Residential construction grew modestly
Recent sales of passenger vehicles decreased, according to auto dealer contacts, while sales of trucks increased slightly
Loan demand was steady to increasing in most Districts
Retail prices held steady or slightly increased, and the manufacturing sector noted steady to modestly rising input costs
New residential construction activity has been steady at a subdued level, while commercial construction has picked up modestly
Manufacturers have continued to add jobs but at a somewhat slower pace than in the last report
Bankers reported slightly easier credit standards for residential mortgages, and unchanged standards in other loan categories
Businesses in most service industries reported steady to moderately growing business activity
Commercial real estate markets have been mixed but slightly softer on balance
Inventories were generally at or below normal levels, while prices were steady to up modestly
However, auto sales and construction activity exhibited essentially no growth, if not a slight decline, and nonauto retail sales declined modestly
Employment has continued at a modest pace of growth
Financial firms reported slight growth of overall loan volumes (excluding credit cards)--a bit slower than the modest growth that had occurred during the prior Beige Book period
Service-sector firms continued to report modest growth in general activity, with some notable improvement in sales (or revenues) over the prior period
Homebuilders generally reported a slight decline in activity, following moderate growth in the prior period, although one builder noted a pick-up in mid-June
Nonauto retail contacts noted modest declines in sales overall, as apparel sales "continued to be hammered
Coal production was little changed in recent weeks but rose moderately compared to the same time last year
Manufacturers' shipments increased but new orders softened due to a typical seasonal slowdown
Wge increases remained modest for most firms
Residential mortgage demand remained solid while refinance and home equity lending softened slightly
Demand for self-storage units rose moderately
Residential real estate sales increased modestly since the previous report
Hardware and home improvement stores reported strong sales, including for big-ticket and seasonal items
Activity in the agriculture sector picked up to a modest pace over the reporting period
Conditions in the manufacturing sector improved, and activity in the agriculture sector picked up to a modest pace
Sluggish sales growth and rising compensation costs slowed the pace of hiring in the restaurant industry
Deposits continued to increase but at a slower pace than in previous months
Production of manufactured pharmaceuticals expanded moderately
Financing conditions for commercial projects tightened slightly
Tourism demand remained strong, although contacts noted that continued uncertainty surrounding immigration policy slowed international bookings at hotels in Southern California
Agricultural conditions improved modestly by the end of June as row-crop farms recovered from flooding
Employers reported little hiring and moderate wage pressures due to difficulties finding qualified candidates
Across the District, home prices continued to increase moderately
Commercial and industrial lending exhibited moderate growth over the period, though slightly softer than in recent quarters
Manufacturing activity has increased modestly since our previous report
Residential real estate activity has declined modestly since the previous report
Multiple auto dealers reported an increase in sales, albeit at a slower pace relative to a year ago
